title: The Missing Manuscript
description: An ancient text has vanished from the university archives. Step into the role of an investigator, follow the trail of clues, and uncover the truth before the manuscript is lost forever.

intro.text: You stand at the gates of the Ashwell University Library, where rumors swirl of a priceless manuscript gone missing. The evening air is cool, and the lamplight glows warmly against the stone walls. Somewhere inside, the truth awaits.

libraryEntrance.text: The library’s grand hall is quiet, its vaulted ceiling stretching overhead. Shelves line the walls, and the scent of old parchment fills the air. Something is amiss—the usual order feels disturbed.

talkGuard.text: The guard hesitates when you ask about the missing manuscript. He recalls seeing a figure leaving late last night, carrying a satchel, but insists it wasn’t his job to interfere.

guardDetails.text: Reluctantly, he admits the figure was tall, wearing a long coat, and headed toward the east wing. He quickly changes the subject, clearly uncomfortable.

librarianDesk.text: The desk is cluttered with catalog cards and a half-empty teacup. You notice a torn scrap of parchment tucked under a ledger.

choices.label: Read the parchment scrap
choices.clue: Clue: Fragment of an old inventory.

parchmentScrap.text: The scrap lists manuscripts under lock and key. One title is circled: 'Codex Noctis.' In hurried handwriting beneath it: 'Check ownership records—possible dispute.'

restrictedDoor.text: You arrive at a heavy iron door marked 'Restricted Archives.' The lock has been tampered with—someone forced their way inside.

eastWingExterior.text: The east wing of the library looms quietly. A broken window on the second floor suggests someone climbed out in a hurry.

eastWingWindow.text: The climb is challenging, but you pull yourself inside. The study smells faintly of ink and dust. On the floor lies a satchel with initials burned into the leather.

choices.label: Search the rest of the study

archives.text: The restricted archives are a maze of locked cabinets and dusty tomes. A row of shelves has been overturned, papers scattered across the floor.

footprints.text: The footprints lead away from the archives toward the east stairwell. Whoever it was, they moved quickly.

choices.label: Ignore them and return to the archives

satchel.text: Inside the satchel, you find broken quills, a folded letter, and a brass key. The letter reads: 'Meet me at the clock tower—midnight.'

studySearch.text: The study’s shelves hold nothing unusual, but a draft slips through a crack in the wall. A hidden door stands slightly ajar.

shelvesSearch.text: Among the toppled books you find another parchment, torn in half. It matches the earlier scrap. Together, they hint at a dispute over the Codex Noctis between collectors.

choices.label: Keep the parchment and continue
choices.clue: Clue: Completed parchment about ownership dispute.

secretPassage.text: You press against the wall and feel it shift. With a low groan, a hidden passage opens, leading downward into an older part of the building.

stairwell.text: The stairwell spirals downward. Halfway, you hear muffled voices echoing below.

overhear.text: You hear two academics arguing: 'The Codex must be presented tonight.' 'And if the university finds out?' 'Then our chance at recognition is gone.'

hiddenChamber.text: The chamber is lined with stone, a single pedestal in the center. But it is empty—the manuscript has already been removed.

clueDiscovery.text: Carved into the floor is a symbol of the university’s founding society. Footprints lead toward another exit.

undergroundHall.text: You emerge into a forgotten hall beneath the university. At the far end, a group of rival scholars huddle around a table. The missing manuscript lies before them.

confrontation.text: You step into the open. The rivals look up in surprise. One clutches the manuscript protectively, while another quickly covers a stack of notes.

finalChoice.text: The lead scholar glares: 'This manuscript will make our careers. Why should you decide its fate?' The tension is palpable as you prepare to act.

choices.label: Propose joint custody with the university

goodEnding.text: With a decisive move, you secure the Codex and ensure it returns to the university’s care. The archives may rest easy—for now.

alternateEnding.text: You persuade the rivals to agree on joint preservation. The Codex will be studied openly, ensuring knowledge is shared rather than hoarded.

badEnding.text: Your attempt to snatch the manuscript fails. In the scuffle, the rivals escape with it into the night. The mystery remains unsolved—for now.
